intro: Anisum creticum, commonly known as Cretan fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has feathery, finely divided leaves. It is often found growing in rocky or dry soils, thriving in sunny environments. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to fennel.
